address: 1039 E. Valley Blvd., Suite 205B, San Gabriel, CA 91776
mission: To safeguard private property rights by promoting adherence to the REALTOR® Code of Ethics and supporting the professional competency of our members.
vision: To provide tools, products, services, and education that help members be more productive in the real estate profession.

About.description: The West San Gabriel Valley REALTORS® serves real estate professionals through advocacy, education, MLS services, and networking. WSGVR is affiliated with the California Association of REALTORS® and the National Association of REALTORS®.

Membership.join: You can join online through the membership page or visit the office in person. Requirements include a completed application, real estate license, and payment for dues and fees.
Membership.renew: Renew online via the member portal or at the office. Renewal reminders are sent before the due date.
Membership.transfer: To transfer from another association, provide a letter of good standing and complete the transfer form.
Membership.affiliate: Affiliate Membership is available for vendors and service providers in the real estate industry.

Dues & Payments.billing: Annual dues are billed in December and due by January 1.
Dues & Payments.methods: We accept credit card, check, or online payments through the member portal.

MLS & Tech Support.access: Active members receive CRMLS login credentials by email.
MLS & Tech Support.support: For login issues, contact CRMLS at (800) 925-1525 or support@crmls.org.
MLS & Tech Support.training: WSGVR hosts regular CRMLS training sessions both in-person and online. See the calendar at https://www.wsgvr.org/calendar.

Education & Events.registration: Register online at https://www.wsgvr.org/calendar or call the office.

Lockboxes & Supra.get_key: Visit the office with a valid ID and membership info to activate your eKey or rent a lockbox.
Lockboxes & Supra.return: Lockboxes can be returned during business hours at the Member Services Desk.

Advocacy & Ethics.code_of_ethics: All members must uphold the REALTOR® Code of Ethics. Training is provided regularly to maintain compliance.
Advocacy & Ethics.complaints: Download the ethics complaint form from the website or pick one up at the office. Submit it with supporting documents to Professional Standards.

Local Market Data.info: Monthly housing market statistics are available on the website and distributed via newsletters.

zapier_ideas: Google Sheets - Log new chatbot leads
CRM (HubSpot or Follow Up Boss) - Add new leads automatically

Lead Capture.prompt: To help you better, can I get your name, email, and the type of property you’re interested in? One of our REALTORS® will reach out shortly.

Customization Tips: Keep tone friendly, helpful, and professional.
Use real listings or local neighborhood names in examples.
Add a persona like 'Hi, I'm Alex, your WSGVR virtual assistant!'
